title: Bug while drawing wide arc in canvas
content:
I recently updated the version of linux I use, now Linux Mint 22 cinnamon. I couldn't tell if it was the latest firefox update that caused the problem. But previously, when I drew two wide arcs with angles that followed each other in a canvas, the junction was perfect. Now I see that they don't follow each other perfectly. Here's a little code to test: ``` ctx.beginPath(); ctx.lineCap = "butt"; ctx.strokeStyle = 'red'; ctx.arc(75, 75, 50, 0, Math.PI); ctx.stroke(); ctx.beginPath(); ctx.lineCap = "butt"; ctx.strokeStyle = 'green'; ctx.arc(75, 75, 50, Math.PI, 0); ctx.stroke(); ```

I've attached two example images, first firefox 129 and second chromium Do you have the problem?

For dig a bit, I just test troubleshooting mode and see result is ok ! So I've disabled the extensions one by one, except Simple Tab Group because it had too much impact, the bug is still there. Maybe a setting in about:config, but how can I find out which one?

Maybe a setting in about:config, but how can I find out which one?

Thanks for your help

title: A question on the Mozilla account (I only have one account)
content:
I've just reset my Mozilla account password after having received multiple emails with authorization codes that failed. Prior to that, my password was rejected several times and I was asked for my 'one-time recovery key' (or something close to that). I couldn't find this, assuming I actually set one up, so proceeded and accepted that I may lose some bookmarks or other account-related items. Is there more information on what might be lost?

(For what it's worth, I've had this account for a long time. I've used it at work and home. I will retire in a few months and have been changing (or deleting) existing Firefox logins to a new non-work email address, using Thunderbird as a mail client. If there are any guidelines concerning an organized approach to doing this, please point me to them.)

title: Problemas ao utilizar o navegador
content:
Prezada equipe do Firefox,

Espero que esta mensagem os encontre bem. Sou um usuário do Firefox e gostaria de compartilhar algumas sugestões que, na minha opinião, poderiam melhorar a experiência de navegação.

Atualmente, quando abro links da minha barra de favoritos, o navegador me direciona automaticamente para cada um deles. Eu gostaria de ter a opção de abrir vários links em novas abas sem ser redirecionado imediatamente para cada um. Essa funcionalidade já está disponível em outros navegadores e, embora possa parecer simples, é algo que aprecio e que tornaria minha navegação mais eficiente.

OBS. Falo na hora de utilizar o scroll do mouse.

Outro problema que vejo é que, ao abrir um vídeo no navegador em tela cheia, a tela pisca, como se fosse um movimento de abrir e fechar os olhos de uma pessoa. Acredito que essa função poderia ser aprimorada; em vez de piscar, o vídeo poderia ser colocado em tela cheia de forma mais suave e direta.

Agradeço pela atenção e pelo excelente trabalho que vocês realizam. Estou ansioso para ver como o Firefox continuará a evoluir no futuro.

Atenciosamente,
creator: dxht72

title: Disable Password Sync at registry level
content: We require disabling password sync at org-level by deploying changes in registry or Group Policy. Currently we do not see any option to disable password sync except at browser level which leaves the user in control. However as IT and security admins, we would like to implement this as a global policy so corporate portal passwords are not synced to unmanaged devices. Please suggest a solution.

title: How to Restore Favicons Lost for All Bookmarks in FF 129.0.2 (64-bit)
content:
On two occasions all of the favicons for my Bookmarks have disappeared. The only way I have been able to restore them is to open each bookmark using "Open All in Tabs" for each Bookmark folder. As I have many hundreds of Bookmarks, this is an extremely time consuming process. I have done this twice. I have just encountered a third instance of this problem and would like to avoid doing it again if there is any other way to restore the favicons.

I had saved the favicons.sqlite files from the Profile, but I am unaware of any way to restore the favicons directly from this file. The favicons.sqlite file appears to be of the proper size, i.e. ~17KB. On the last occasion, following a suggested solution, I rebuilt the iconcache hoping it would also rebuild the favicons, but that was not the case. As a result, I used the above process.

Any solutions to restore the Bookmark favicons without opening all with "Open All in Tabs" would be greatly apprecuated. I don't know what has caused the favicons to disappear. I am running Firefox 129.0.2 on a Windows 11 Pro PC.

Allan
creator: Ulysses41

title: YouTube UI sometimes freezes frequently (~ every 10 seconds) for 2-3 seconds
content:
Frequently, I notice on Youtube the UI just freezes entirely for ~1-5 seconds, usually periodically. I've measured it most recently around every 10 seconds or so (manual stopwatch in another tab, so a little faster or slower possible).

When in this state, I can often notice it frequently: on hovering over buttons the UI does not highlight them, the video controls will not appear, or the page will not fill the screen on resize, can't click into search, etc. Basically just full page freeze except for media playback.

It's disappeared and come back a few times, but tends to be more often there than not. This occurs on every page of Youtube. I've tried disabling basically all my extensions and refreshing the page without any change.

I've also captured a performance profile while I was moving around between buttons and observing the issue, as I assume it might help diagnose: https://share.firefox.dev/3Xqz7co
creator: HowlsMinimalPots

Adblock Plus Instructions
